node.title: Four Wellington suburbs without water after pipeline breaks
node.description: Residents in four southern Wellington suburbs are expected to be without water for most of the day after a pipeline broke.

node.title: Wave tower damaged by cyclone Dovi being removed from Port Taranaki
node.description: Work is under way to remove a wave tower off Port Taranaki severely damaged during ex cyclone Dovi.

node.title: NYC mayor unveils plan to bar people from sheltering on subway trains
node.description: Residents could see changes as soon as next week, Adams said.

node.title: Cricket: Nicholls and Blundell push Black Caps towards quick victory over South Africa in first Test
node.description: New Zealand is closing in on a massive victory inside three days in the opening cricket Test against South Africa.

node.title: Biden: U.S. has reason to believe Russia has decided to invade Ukraine
node.description: The U.S. believes Russia is capable of attacking Ukraine any day.

node.title: Jobs for Nature: More than 5000 jobs and 3.2m plants so far
node.description: The Jobs for Nature Covid-19 recovery programme has sprouted into more than 5000 jobs and 3.2 million plants, the Conservation Minister says.

node.title: Auckland Covid-19 PCR tests taking up to five days to process
node.description: Covid-19 PCR test results are taking up to five days to process in Auckland, while Christchurch Hospital has an extra ward for Covid patients as Omicron numbers grow in the city.

node.title: Trump can be sued for role in Jan. 6 attack on Capitol, judge rules
node.description: The judge also threw out legal claims against Donald Trump Jr. and former Trump personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani.

node.title: White House blames Russia for cyberattacks against Ukrainian sites
node.description: The U.S. has technical information linking Russia to the attacks, says the deputy national security adviser Anne Neuberger.

node.title: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," February 20, 2022
node.description: Secretary of State Anthony Blinken, NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg and more appear on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" Sunday.

node.title: MLB postpones spring training games amid labor dispute
node.description: MLB said Friday the owners' bargaining committee is committed to "starting the season on time."

node.title: Police warn Canada protesters of 'imminent' action to clear them
node.description: Canadian police have warned protesters occupying central Ottawa of "imminent" action to clear them from the capital with arrests now being made to end a crisis that Prime Minister Justin Trudeau says…

node.title: National Archives confirms it found classified materials at Mar-a-Lago
node.description: The National Archives said it is in communication with the Justice Department about the classified information.

node.title: Lack of support for young female offenders
node.description: The Principal Youth Court Judge says there is a clear lack of targeted gender-specific support for young female offenders, and he wants action.

node.title: U.S. lifts ban on avocados imported from Mexico
node.description: The decision comes after the USDA said one of its employees was threatened, prompting a halt in imports of the fruit from Mexico.

node.title: Thousands of mail ballots face possible rejection in Texas
node.description: A substantial percentage of these ballots are being flagged because of their failure to comply with the state's new election law.

node.title: Supreme Court agrees to weigh in on "Remain in Mexico" border policy
node.description: President Biden has denounced the Trump-era border policy as draconian and inhumane.

node.title: 'It's not okay to threaten people': Ngāti Toa CEO
node.description: A Wellington iwi says abuse and threats at the protest at Parliament need to stop. Audio

node.title: Man charged with murder of Abdul Kareem
node.description: A 35-year-old man will appear in the Hamilton District Court today charged with the murder of Auckland man Abdul Kareem.

node.title: Stocks close down for the week as markets eye Ukraine and Fed
node.description: Financial markets retreat in the face of rising tensions in Eastern Europe and an expected interest rate hike in the U.S.

node.title: Henry Cuellar tries to fend off progressive challengers in reelection bid
node.description: The congressional rematch between moderate incumbent Henry Cuellar and progressive challenger Jessica Cisneros is the first noteworthy House primary of the year.

node.title: Daunte Wright's mother angered by Kim Potter's smiling mug shot
node.description: Katie Wright brought up the mug shot as she addressed the court, saying it showed Potter wasn't genuinely sorry for his her son's death.

node.title: Suspended Columbia U. doctor sentenced for abusing former patient
node.description: The former patient addressed Joel Lavine in court, saying, "In hindsight I see how you groomed me for years since I was a minor in your care."

node.title: British diving instructor named as victim of fatal Sydney shark attack
node.description: A 35-year-old British diving instructor has been identified as the person killed in a shark attack off a Sydney beach, as officials reopened several beaches after the city's first fatal attack in 60…

node.title: Soaring U.S. car prices lead to sticker shock for buyers
node.description: Most new car buyers are having to pay thousands above automakers' suggested retail prices. Here's why.

node.title: The sport of Olympic pin trading
node.description: Collectors go for the gold in what is one of the most competitive of Olympics events: trading hard-to-find pins that commemorate the Games.

node.title: Big increase in kererū and pīwakawaka seen in New Zealand gardens - survey
node.description: New research shows there are significantly more kererū and pīwakawaka in our backyards than there were 10 years ago.

node.title: Surgeon general and his entire family test positive for COVID-19
node.description: The nation's top doctor has encouraged vaccines and boosters to fend off the worst of the virus.

node.description: The U.S. believes Russia is capable of attacking Ukraine any day.

node.title: Melania Trump launches a third NFT collection
node.description: Bidding for each item starts at $50, but "the artwork of each collection is revealed only after purchase," the former first lady said.
